instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3435: What is 820-3435? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS: What is PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS? This power rail is PPBUS_G3H after going through a current sense resistor that sits between PPBUS_G3H & the input of PPBUS_G3H to circuitry that provides power for the CPU..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Hi, can someone please tell me either <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> resistance to groung or what voltage drop to look for in diode mode from <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> to ground on an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board?

EDIT Just noticed that the whole bank of bypass caps on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS</SIGNAL> burns my fingers.

EDIT Sorry, issue is no power, 0v on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Caps removed...

Woohoo, fan spin! Let's see if we have some screen and chimes going on.

EDIT Yep all good.

Anyone know if tantilum caps vs ceramic caps are more likely to fuck up?.... I'm sure at some point tant was very unstable and even used to explode many many years ago.
